instruction: In a fine-mesh strainer, rinse the quinoa under cold running water for 30 seconds to remove any bitterness.
Combine the rinsed quinoa, water, and a pinch of salt in a medium saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, cover the pot tightly with a lid, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for an additional 5 minutes. This allows the quinoa to steam and finish absorbing any remaining water.
Fluff the quinoa with a fork and serve hot or at room temperature.
